Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia

Origin: Valle del Cauca growing region, Colombia
Origin_String: Valle del Cauca growing region, Colombia
Name: Café Granja La Esperanza Sudan Rume Natural
Review: A shape-shifter of a coffee: brilliant, original, absorbing.

Name: La Papaya Ecuador
Review: An aromatically bright and rousing Typica cup, high-toned with bittersweet citrus and rich spice notes.

Name: Aponte Colombia
Review: An attractive composite of tart and savory elements and an exciting coffee, given the historic limitations on processing in Colombia.

Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Origin_String: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia

Review: Classic Sumatra genius: chocolate and earth, sweet-savory berry, balanced and complete.

Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Origin_String: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Name: Boru Batak Sumatra
Review: Fine traditional Sumatra, lightly plump and juicy in mouthfeel, aromatically driven by earth-nuanced pungent fruit and dry chocolate.

Origin_String: Gayo (also Aceh) growing region, Aceh Province, northern Sumatra, Indonesia

Origin_String: Simalungun Regency, North Sumatra Province, Sumatra, Indonesia

Origin_String: Gayo (also Aceh) growing region, Aceh Province, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Sumatra Pantan Musara
Review: For lovers of depth and sweet-savory resonance — those who enjoy the roundly sweet/tart/savory character of a fine ripe tomato, for example.

Origin: Gayo (also Aceh) growing region, Aceh Province, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Origin_String: Gayo (also Aceh) growing region, Aceh Province, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Sumatra Aceh Gayo Mountain Kenawat Raisin Honey

Origin: Gayo (also Aceh) growing region, Aceh Province, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Origin_String: Gayo (also Aceh) growing region, Aceh Province, northern Sumatra, Indonesia
Name: Ketiara Sumatra
Review: Attractive choice for lovers of the traditional Sumatra wet-hulled profile: earthy, pungent, yet bright, offering bonus satisfaction for supporters of progressive, women-led cooperatives.

Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Origin_String: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Name: Sumatra Lintong
Review: Bright and vivacious, yet resonantly deep: a Sumatra for all seasons.

Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Natural Guji Hambela G1 Bishan Fugu
Review: A rich-toned, resonant, cleanly fruity natural-processed Ethiopia cup with delicate florals and sweet musky notes throughout.

Name: Tanzania Tarime AB
Review: A high-toned yet deeply savory Tanzania cup with resonant stone fruit and spicy floral notes throughout.

Name: El Salvador Cerro Las Ranas Honey Espresso
Review: A deeply sweet, chocolaty and spice-toned El Salvador, adeptly roasted for espresso.

Name: Blossom Single Origin Espresso
Review: A light-footed, exhilaratingly bright and juicy espresso, complex as both straight shot and in short milk.

Name: Panama Baru Geisha Black
Review: An intentionally ferment-toned Geisha cup with exquisite balance: notes of passionfruit on the sweet end of the spectrum and hops on the savory, with dark chocolate running through the whole.

Name: Kenya Safari AB Top
Review: Superb and classic Kenya, intense in structure, layered and resonantly intricate in aroma and flavor.

Name: No. 79 Blend Espresso
Review: A balanced, expressive espresso blend with dessert-like aroma and flavor notes.

Origin: Campos Alto district, Minas Gerais State, southeastern Brazil
Origin_String: Campos Alto district, Minas Gerais State, southeastern Brazil
Name: Brazil Para Ela Natural
Review: A beautiful berry-centric natural-processed coffee from Brazil, with especially high-toned acidity and deep cocoa notes throughout.

Name: Tumba Rwanda
Review: An attractively savory-leaning Rwanda cup whose leading descriptor is sweet squash; this unusual but pleasing note is supported by sweet herb and spicy floral suggestions, rounded by a rich cocoa.

Origin: Harar (also Harrar) growing region of eastern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Harar (also Harrar) growing region of eastern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Harrar
Review: Crisp, chocolaty, roast-toned cup, with a zesty edge.

Origin: Kona growing district, Big Island of Hawaii
Origin_String: Kona growing district, Big Island of Hawaii

Review: A plush, smooth roast-touched Kona.

Name: Mellower Blend
Review: A round, rich-toned cup with a whisper of grappa-like sweet ferment.

Name: Espresso Blend
Review: A bold, deeply chocolate-toned espresso blend with particular resonance in milk.

Origin: San Ignacio Province, Cajamarca Region, northern Peru
Origin_String: San Ignacio Province, Cajamarca Region, northern Peru
Name: Peru Chirinois

Name: Ecuador Finca La Papaya
Review: A solid Ecuador cup, balanced and friendly, with appealing cocoa notes throughout.

Origin_String: Utcubamba Province, Amazonas Region, north-central Peru

Name: Ecuador Pichincha Typica
Review: An elegant, balanced Ecuador cup saturated with notes of tropical fruit and spicy flowers.

Name: Ecuador Finca Carolina Fausto Romo
Review: An impressive Ecuador cup: big, resonant, layered with sweet stone fruit and rich nut tones.

Origin_String: Jaén Province, Cajamarca Region, northern Peru

Origin_String: Caranavi Province, La Paz Department, west-central Bolivia
Name: Bolivia Yungas Caranavi Finca Las Alasitas Peaberry

Origin_String: Hambela Wamena District, Guji Zone, Oromia region, southern Ethiopia

Origin_String: Captain Cook, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii

Origin: Captain Cook, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Origin_String: Captain Cook, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Name: Kona Naturals
Review: A fruit-driven natural-processed Kona Typica cup with a pleasing hint of grappa-like sweet ferment.

Name: Rwanda Rulindo Tumba
Review: A rich, pleasing Rwanda coffee with berry notes, vanilla-like florals, and an appealing hint of sweet herbs.

Origin: Region Concepción Huista, Huehuetenango growing region, Guatemala
Origin_String: Region Concepción Huista, Huehuetenango growing region, Guatemala
Name: Guatemala Quejina
Review: A citrus-driven, quite bright Guatemala cup with a pretty floral note akin to candied violet.

Name: Flight Seasonal Espresso
Review: An espresso blend creatively comprised of both washed- and natural-processed coffees, the former bringing bright florals to the cup, the latter, deep fruit.

Origin: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Origin_String: Sabanilla de Alajuela, Central Valley, Costa Rica
Name: Costa Rica Las Lajas Black Honey
Review: A crisp, richly sweet, berry-driven black honey from Costa Rica.

Name: Eaagads Estate Kenya
Review: A beautiful Kenya cup with layers of intrigue, from the classic cocoa-toned currant note to the pleasing twist of sweetly savory herbs.

Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Guji
Review: An aromatically saturated, flavor-deep cup that hits all of the classic Ethiopia notes: fruit, florals, cocoa and aromatic wood.

Name: California Grown
Review: A splurge coffee, crisply classic in the cup, rare and precious in its aspiration and story.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe G1
Review: A pretty, floral-toned Ethiopia cup with particularly vibrant acidity and plush mouthfeel.

Name: Kenya Karindundu AA Small Lot Reserve
Review: A perfectly structured coffee alive with aromatic intrigue. It gave us far too many positive descriptors to list. Just a few more: dried mulberry, blood orange zest, raw honey.

Name: Rwanda Kanzu
Review: Big, characteristic Rwanda sweet-tartness juxtaposed with savory depth, with a supporting intrigue of spice, flowers and complex fruit.

Name: Ethiopia Kochere Natural
Review: A deeply satisfying, impeccably clean natural Ethiopia cup: a chocolate bomb lifted by pretty notes of dried berries and high-toned florals.

Name: Cirque Tarrazu F1 Natural
Review: One of the better specialty instants we’ve tested, with persuasive brightness, deep sweetness, and a plush, appealing mouthfeel.

Name: Kenya Thirikwa Single-Origin Espresso
Review: A deftly darker-roasted, rich-toned, confident Kenya espresso, classic in roast style, as well as in expression of its origin: bright, juicy, balanced, deep.

Name: Mocha Java Blend Fair Trade Organic
Review: A balanced, richly sweet-tart Ethiopia-Sumatra blend that’s also fair trade and organic-certified.

Origin: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Origin_String: Lintong growing region, North Sumatra Province, Indonesia
Name: Sumatra Tano Batak
Review: A classic Sumatra coffee: aromatically seductive, with deep florals and sweet fruit notes, supported by a fresh, foresty earthiness.

Name: Moonbow Decaf
Review: A very impressive decaf, tested here for drip or other non-espresso applications: Sweet, balanced, cocoa-driven.

Name: Colombia La Guamera Honey
Review: A deeply sweet, subtly fruit-toned cup processed by the honey method, unusual for coffees from Colombia.

Name: Moonbow Decaf Espresso
Review: A fine decaf espresso blend animated by tart fruit and bittersweet citrus zest notes, with a cocoa throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe
Review: A deftly darker-roasted Yirgacheffe cup centered around notes of dark chocolate and spicy florals, with a particularly satisfying mouthfeel.

Name: Rwanda Mushonyi Natural
Review: A fine Rwanda natural: clean, bright, juicy, mesmerizing.

Name: Rwanda Mushonyi
Review: A sweet-toned Rwanda cup with pretty floral and stone fruit notes throughout.

Name: Ethiopia Washed Kochere
Review: A floral- and tropical fruit-toned wet-processed Ethiopia cup.

Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Name: Feku Double
Review: A classic wet-processed Ethiopia cup: bright and vibrant, with leading notes of stone fruit and cocoa.

Review: A pretty Ethiopia coffee characterized by tropical fruit and spice-toned flowers.

Review: A confident, savory-leaning, rich-toned Colombia cup.

Name: Kenya AB
Review: A deeply sweet Kenya cup with a developed roast profile that equally prioritizes flowers and chocolate.

Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia

Review: A spice-driven, fruit-forward natural-processed Ethiopia cup: rich, resonant, clean, deep.

Review: A lush Tanzania cup laden with red fruit and deep chocolate tones throughout, lifted by a bright acidity.

Name: Bombe Natural Sidama
Review: An especially clean natural-processed coffee: a fruit bomb tempered by rich aromatic wood notes.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Botabaa G1
Review: A citrus-driven wet-processed Ethiopia cup with fragrant aromatic wood notes throughout.

Origin_String: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii

Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia

Review: A nuanced, multi-layered washed Ethiopia cup with a deep floral profile and energetic lift from an elegant spice throughline.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Kochere
Review: Citrus-driven, sweetly herb-toned, very delicate yet aromatically rich.

Origin: Planadas, southern Tolima growing region, Colombia
Origin_String: Planadas, southern Tolima growing region, Colombia

Name: Espresso
Review: A rich, resonant espresso from Thailand, especially attractive in cappuccino-scaled milk.

Name: Kenya Ruthaka Peaberry
Review: A high-toned, nuanced Kenya cup, classic in its presentation of sweet-tart currant and deep chocolate notes.

Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Origin_String: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Name: Ethiopia Gora Kone Sidamo
Review: A playful, unrestrained fruit bomb of a coffee, rich with berry and fudgy chocolate notes throughout.

Review: A subtly but strikingly original Honduras coffee: deep, complex and sweetly spice-toned.

Origin: Kalehe, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo
Origin_String: Kalehe, South Kivu Province, Democratic Republic of the Congo

Review: A rich, savory-leaning Pacas cup with tremendous depth of aroma and flavor.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe Awassa
Review: A high-toned, juicy Yirgacheffe cup, classic in its balance of bright fruit, sweet floral and cocoa tones.

Name: Colombia Geisha

Name: Guatemala Hunapu

Name: Ethiopia Banko Dhadhato Washed
Review: A classic version of the Yirgacheffe cup, all seductive flowers, soft citrus, and cocoa.

Name: Kenya Rugeto Peaberry
Review: A balanced and engaging Kenya: high-toned with spicy floral and delicate cocoa notes.

Origin: Aceh growing region, Aceh Province, northern Sumatra, Indonesia

Review: Expressive and resonant: Spice-toned florals and sweetly savory pipe tobacco offer rich throughlines.

Name: Kenya Nyeri Nudurutu Factory AB
Review: A harmonious Kenya that gracefully integrates sweet and savory, bright and bitter, in vibrant balance.

Name: Ethiopia Kochere Washed Saona Lot
Review: Dynamic, engaging, classic washed Ethiopia cup, propelled by sweet floral and juicy stone-fruit notes.

Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia

Name: El Salvador Pacamara

Origin: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia
Origin_String: Guji Zone, Oromia Region, southern Ethiopia

Review: A fine Ethiopia wet-processed cup: balanced and engaging, with stone fruit and sweet florals as throughlines.

Origin: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia
Origin_String: Sidamo (also Sidama) growing region, south-central Ethiopia

Review: A friendly darker-roasted espresso blend with satisfying dark chocolate and raisiny dried fruit tones throughout.

Name: 100% Arabica Freeze-Dried Colombian (Instant Coffee)

Name: Perla del Otún
Review: A sweet-toned, engaging Colombia cup with crisp baker’s chocolate as a throughline.

Name: Decaf Classic Espresso
Review: A solid, straightfoward decaf espresso from Colombia, especially chocolaty in cappuccino-scaled milk.

Name: Colombia El Sauce
Review: A crisply sweet Colombia cup driven by engaging floral notes and hints of red apple and fresh-cut fir.

Name: Kiunyu Peaberry
Review: A rich-toned Kenya carried by pleasing savory notes that support and balance the coffee’s deep sweetness.

Name: El Aguila SL28 El Salvador
Review: A subtle but persuasive version of the resonantly pungent, berry-and-flowers Kenya-style cup.

Name: Nano Challa

Origin_String: Poás Volcano region, central Costa Rica

Origin_String: Holualoa, North Kona growing district, “Big Island” of Hawaii
Name: Kona Mocca®
Review: A marvel of a coffee, inviting and esoteric, chimerical and grounded, all at once.

Name: Kibugu Kenya
Review: A classic Kenya with an umami intrigue that balances the rich sweetness of the cup: multi-layered, paradoxical yet complete.

Name: Poseidon Blend Espresso
Review: A deftly blended espresso as good as a straight shot as in milk: rich, high-toned, exuberant with fruit and flowers.

Name: Kenya Gikirima Kibugu
Review: A deeply sweet, richly savory Kenya cup, with pleasingly intense notes of aromatic wood (think fresh pine forest) underneath melon and cocoa tones.

Name: Kenya AA Top Gachatha
Review: A classically balanced Kenya cup with pretty fruit and floral tones and a bright, engaging acidity.

Name: Ethiopia Yirgacheffe G1 Chachale Natural
Review: A cleanly fruit-forward natural-processed Ethiopia cup, redolent with ripe berry notes.

Name: Quejina Guatemala
Review: A friendly, straightforward, pleasing Guatemala cup.

Name: Christmas Blend
Review: A chocolaty coffee fragrant with spice notes that invoke the winter holidays.

Name: Thanksgiving Blend
Review: A pleasing chocolate-first holiday blend for those who prefer an adeptly darker-roasted coffee.

Name: Elida Estate Geisha Natural Dragonfly Reserve
Review: An exuberant fruit- and floral-driven natural-processed Geisha, vibrant and engaging, with an intriguing spice-toned complication.

Name: Guatemala Pacamara Natural
Review: A multi-layered cup redolent with stone fruit, sweet nuts and pungent florals, animated by a bright, engaging acidity.

Name: Finca Insul Guatemala Pacamara
Review: A balanced, richly sweet coffee driven by notes of stone fruit punctuated by spice tones throughout.

Name: Cuxinales Guatemala

Review: A balanced washed-process Ethiopia cup with pleasing notes of stone fruit and baker’s chocolate as throughlines.

Review: An accessible, cleanly fruit-toned natural-processed espresso blend.

Name: Kenya Konyu
Review: A multi-layered Kenya coffee with a perfect balance of sweet, tart and savory notes — in particular, dried berries and richly bittersweet flowers.

Review: A friendly, floral-toned Guatemala cup with undercurrents of rich hazelnut.

Name: Kanyonyi Coffee Blend
Review: The sale of this impressively chocolaty and floral Uganda cup provides multifaceted support aimed at preserving mountain gorillas in their human and natural environment.
